net.sf.libai.fuzzy
Class Rule

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.libai.fuzzy.Rule

public class Rule
extends java.lang.Object

Implementation of a fuzzy rule. Is contructed with a condition and a set of one or more "actions". In the bottom line, the actions are fuzzy sets. The important part in this reasoning process is related with the concept of FuzzyGroup. A FuzzyGroup allow creating linguistic variables with a concrete meaning, therefore, all the fuzzy sets in this actions must belong to one fuzzy group attached to the engine.

Author:
kronenthaler

public Rule(Condition _cond,
            FuzzySet... acts)
Constructor. Create a new rule with a condition tree and a list of fuzzy sets (actions).

Parameters:
_cond - The condition tree for this rule.
acts - The actions for this rule.
Method Detail

fire

public java.util.ArrayList<Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>>[] fire()
Fire the rule. Evaluate the condition, calculate the respective tau, and make the combination process over the actions. Returning a support set for each action in the rule. This results are combined in the engine to the defuzzify process.

Returns:
An array of ArrayLists of pairs double-double, containing each one the support calculated for the specific set of the action.

getAction

public FuzzySet getAction(int index)
Get the action for at index.

Parameters:
index - The index for the action.
Returns:
The fuzzy set associated to that action.
